   "source": [
    "# PyTorch: Regression"
   ]
  },
  {
   "cell_type": "markdown",
   "id": "final-government",
   "metadata": {},
   "source": [
    "![houses](../images/houses.png)"
   ]
  },
  {
   "cell_type": "code",
   "execution_count": 2,
   "id": "unknown-replica",
   "metadata": {},
   "outputs": [],
   "source": [
    "import torch\n",
    "import torch.nn as nn\n",
    "from torch import optim\n",
    "import torchmetrics\n",
    "\n",
    "from sklearn.preprocessing import StandardScaler, PowerTransformer, OrdinalEncoder\n",
    "\n",
    "import aiqc\n",
    "from aiqc import datum"
   ]
  },
  {
   "cell_type": "markdown",
   "id": "significant-confidence",
   "metadata": {},
   "source": [

       "<div>\n",
       "<style scoped>\n",
       "    .dataframe tbody tr th:only-of-type {\n",

       "      <td>54.2</td>\n",

       "</div>"
      ],
      "text/plain": [
       "      crim    zn  indus  chas    nox     rm   age     dis  rad  tax  ptratio  \\\n",
       "0  0.00632  18.0   2.31     0  0.538  6.575  65.2  4.0900    1  296     15.3   \n",
       "1  0.02731   0.0   7.07     0  0.469  6.421  78.9  4.9671    2  242     17.8   \n",
       "2  0.02729   0.0   7.07     0  0.469  7.185  61.1  4.9671    2  242     17.8   \n",
       "3  0.03237   0.0   2.18     0  0.458  6.998  45.8  6.0622    3  222     18.7   \n",
       "4  0.06905   0.0   2.18     0  0.458  7.147  54.2  6.0622    3  222     18.7   \n",
       "\n",
       "   lstat  price  \n",
       "0   4.98   24.0  \n",
       "1   9.14   21.6  \n",

       "4   5.33   36.2  "

   "source": [
    "df.head()"

   "cell_type": "markdown",
   "id": "interstate-climb",
   "metadata": {},
   "source": [
    "---"
   ]
  },
  {
   "cell_type": "markdown",
   "id": "terminal-colorado",
   "metadata": {},
   "source": [
    "## a) High-Level API"
   ]
  },
  {
   "cell_type": "markdown",
   "id": "guilty-carter",
   "metadata": {},
   "source": [
    "Reference [High-Level API Docs](api_high_level.ipynb) for more information including how to work with non-tabular data."
   ]
  },
  {
   "cell_type": "code",
   "execution_count": 5,
   "id": "consecutive-biodiversity",
   "metadata": {},
   "outputs": [
    {
     "name": "stdout",
     "output_type": "stream",
     "text": [
      "\n",
      "___/ featurecoder_index: 0 \\_________\n",
      "\n",
      "=> The column(s) below matched your filter(s) and were ran through a test-encoding successfully.\n",
      "\n",
      "['crim', 'zn', 'indus', 'nox', 'rm', 'age', 'dis', 'ptratio', 'lstat']\n",
      "\n",
      "=> The remaining column(s) and dtype(s) can be used in downstream Featurecoder(s):\n",
      "{'chas': 'int64', 'rad': 'int64', 'tax': 'int64'}\n",
      "\n",
      "\n",
      "___/ featurecoder_index: 1 \\_________\n",
      "\n",
      "=> The column(s) below matched your filter(s) and were ran through a test-encoding successfully.\n",
      "\n",
      "['chas', 'rad', 'tax']\n",
      "\n",
      "=> Done. All feature column(s) have encoder(s) associated with them.\n",
      "No more Featurecoders can be added to this Encoderset.\n",
      "\n"
     ]
    }
   ],
   "source": [
    "splitset = aiqc.Pipeline.Tabular.make(\n",
    "    dataFrame_or_filePath = df\n",
    "    , label_column = 'price'\n",
    "    , size_test = 0.18\n",
    "    , size_validation = 0.12\n",
    "    , label_encoder = PowerTransformer(method='box-cox', copy=False)\n",
    "    , feature_encoders = [\n",
    "        {\n",
    "            \"sklearn_preprocess\": StandardScaler(copy=False)\n",
    "            , \"dtypes\": ['float64']\n",
    "        },\n",
    "        {\n",
    "            \"sklearn_preprocess\": OrdinalEncoder()\n",
    "            , \"dtypes\": ['int64']\n",
    "        }\n",
    "    ]\n",
    "    \n",
    "    , dtype = None\n",
    "    , features_excluded = None\n",
    "    , fold_count = None\n",
    "    , bin_count = None\n",
    ")"
   ]
  },
  {
   "cell_type": "code",
   "execution_count": 6,
   "id": "lonely-geometry",
   "metadata": {},
   "outputs": [],
   "source": [
    "def fn_build(features_shape, labels_shape, **hp):\n",
    "    # Just giving hyperparameter a shorter reference.\n",
    "    nc = hp['neuron_count']\n",
    "\n",
    "    model = nn.Sequential(\n",
    "        nn.Linear(features_shape[0], nc),\n",
    "        nn.BatchNorm1d(nc,nc),\n",
    "        nn.ReLU(),\n",
    "        nn.Dropout(p=0.4),\n",
    "\n",
    "        nn.Linear(nc, nc),\n",
    "        nn.BatchNorm1d(nc,nc),\n",
    "        nn.ReLU(),\n",
    "        nn.Dropout(p=0.4),\n",
    "\n",
    "        nn.Linear(nc, labels_shape[0])\n",
    "    )\n",
    "    return model"
   ]
  },
  {
   "cell_type": "code",
   "execution_count": 7,
   "id": "digital-thursday",
   "metadata": {},
   "outputs": [],
   "source": [
    "def fn_train(model, loser, optimizer, samples_train, samples_evaluate, **hp):\n",
    "    from torchmetrics.functional import explained_variance as expVar\n",
    "    ## --- Prepare mini batches for analysis ---\n",
    "    batched_features, batched_labels = aiqc.torch_batcher(\n",
    "        samples_train['features'], samples_train['labels'],\n",
    "        batch_size=5, enforce_sameSize=False, allow_1Sample=False\n",
    "    )\n",
    "\n",
    "    # Modeled after `keras.model.History.history` object.\n",
    "    history = {\n",
    "        'loss':list(), 'expVar': list(), \n",
    "        'val_loss':list(), 'val_expVar':list()\n",
    "    }\n",
    "\n",
    "    ## --- Training loop ---\n",
    "    epochs = 75\n",
    "    for epoch in range(epochs):\n",
    "        # --- Batch training ---\n",
    "        for i, batch in enumerate(batched_features):      \n",
    "            # Make raw (unlabeled) predictions.\n",
    "            batch_probability = model(batched_features[i])\n",
    "            batch_flat_labels = batched_labels[i].flatten()\n",
    "            #batch_loss = loser(batch_probability, batch_flat_labels)\n",
    "            batch_loss = loser(batch_probability.flatten(), batch_flat_labels)\n",
    "            # Backpropagation.\n",
    "            optimizer.zero_grad()\n",
    "            batch_loss.backward()\n",
    "            optimizer.step()\n",
    "\n",
    "        ## --- Epoch metrics ---\n",
    "        # Overall performance on training data.\n",
    "        train_probability = model(samples_train['features'])\n",
    "        train_flat_labels = samples_train['labels'].flatten()\n",
    "        train_loss = loser(train_probability.flatten(), train_flat_labels)\n",
    "        train_expVar = expVar(train_probability, samples_train['labels'])\n",
    "        history['loss'].append(float(train_loss))\n",
    "        history['expVar'].append(float(train_expVar))\n",
    "\n",
    "        # Performance on evaluation data.\n",
    "        eval_probability = model(samples_evaluate['features'])\n",
    "        eval_flat_labels = samples_evaluate['labels'].flatten()\n",
    "        eval_loss = loser(eval_probability.flatten(), eval_flat_labels)\n",
    "\n",
    "        eval_expVar = expVar(eval_probability, samples_evaluate['labels'])    \n",
    "        history['val_loss'].append(float(eval_loss))\n",
    "        history['val_expVar'].append(float(eval_expVar))\n",
    "    return model, history"
   ]
  },
  {
   "cell_type": "markdown",
   "id": "selected-dubai",
   "metadata": {},
   "source": [
    "Optional, will be automatically selected based on `analysis_type` if left as `None`."
   ]
  },
  {
   "cell_type": "code",
   "execution_count": 8,
   "id": "worthy-entry",
   "metadata": {},
   "outputs": [],
   "source": [
    "def fn_lose(**hp):\n",
    "    if (hp['loss_type'] == 'mae'):\n",
    "        loser = nn.L1Loss()#mean absolute error.\n",
    "    elif (hp['loss_type'] == 'mse'):\n",
    "        loser = nn.MSELoss()\n",
    "    return loser"
   ]
  },
  {
   "cell_type": "code",
   "execution_count": 9,
   "id": "adequate-causing",
   "metadata": {},
   "outputs": [],
   "source": [
    "hyperparameters = {\n",
    "    \"neuron_count\": [22,24]\n",
    "    , \"loss_type\": [\"mae\",\"mse\"]\n",
    "}"
   ]
  },
  {
   "cell_type": "code",
   "execution_count": 10,
   "id": "varied-edinburgh",
   "metadata": {},
   "outputs": [],
   "source": [
    "queue = aiqc.Experiment.make(\n",
    "    library = \"pytorch\"\n",
    "    , analysis_type = \"regression\"\n",
    "    , fn_build = fn_build\n",
    "    , fn_train = fn_train\n",
    "    , splitset_id = splitset.id\n",
    "    , labelcoder_id = splitset.label.labelcoder.id\n",
    "    , encoderset_id = splitset.featureset.encodersets[0].id\n",
    "    , repeat_count = 1\n",
    "    , hide_test = False\n",
    "    , hyperparameters = hyperparameters\n",
    "    \n",
    "    , fn_lose = fn_lose #optional/ automated\n",
    "    , fn_optimize = None #optional/ automated\n",
    "    , fn_predict = None #optional/ automated\n",
    "    , foldset_id = None\n",
    ")"
   ]
  },
  {
   "cell_type": "code",
   "execution_count": 11,
   "id": "timely-occasion",
   "metadata": {},
   "outputs": [
    {
     "name": "stderr",
     "output_type": "stream",
     "text": [
      "ðŸ”® Training Models ðŸ”®: 100%|â–ˆâ–ˆâ–ˆâ–ˆâ–ˆâ–ˆâ–ˆâ–ˆâ–ˆâ–ˆâ–ˆâ–ˆâ–ˆâ–ˆâ–ˆâ–ˆâ–ˆâ–ˆâ–ˆâ–ˆâ–ˆâ–ˆâ–ˆâ–ˆâ–ˆâ–ˆâ–ˆâ–ˆâ–ˆâ–ˆâ–ˆâ–ˆâ–ˆâ–ˆâ–ˆâ–ˆâ–ˆâ–ˆâ–ˆâ–ˆâ–ˆâ–ˆ| 4/4 [00:43<00:00, 10.97s/it]\n"
     ]
    }
   ],
   "source": [
    "queue.run_jobs()"
   ]
  },
  {
   "cell_type": "markdown",
   "id": "basic-combining",
   "metadata": {},
   "source": [
    "For more information on visualization of performance metrics, reference the [Visualization & Metrics](visualization.html) documentation."
   ]

   "cell_type": "markdown",

    "## b) Low-Level API"
   ]
  },
  {
   "cell_type": "markdown",
   "id": "starting-duration",
   "metadata": {},
   "source": [

   ]
  },
  {
   "cell_type": "code",
   "execution_count": 12,
   "id": "proved-vertical",

   "source": [
    "dataset = aiqc.Dataset.Tabular.from_pandas(df)"
   ]
  },
  {
   "cell_type": "code",
   "execution_count": 13,
   "id": "found-backup",
   "metadata": {},

   "source": [
    "label_column = 'price'"
   ]
  },
  {
   "cell_type": "code",
   "execution_count": 14,
   "id": "aquatic-still",
   "metadata": {},
   "outputs": [],
   "source": [
    "label = dataset.make_label(columns=[label_column])"
   ]
  },
  {
   "cell_type": "code",
   "execution_count": 18,
   "id": "thrown-organic",
   "metadata": {},
   "outputs": [],
   "source": [
    "labelcoder = label.make_labelcoder(\n",
    "    sklearn_preprocess = PowerTransformer(method='box-cox', copy=False)\n",
    ")"
   ]
  },
  {
   "cell_type": "code",
   "execution_count": 15,
   "id": "affecting-enough",
   "metadata": {},
   "outputs": [],
   "source": [
    "featureset = dataset.make_featureset(exclude_columns=[label_column])"
   ]
  },
  {
   "cell_type": "code",
   "execution_count": 17,
   "id": "false-expansion",
   "metadata": {},
   "outputs": [],
   "source": [
    "encoderset = featureset.make_encoderset()"
   ]
  },
  {
   "cell_type": "code",
   "execution_count": 19,
   "id": "advance-injury",
   "metadata": {},
   "outputs": [
    {
     "name": "stdout",
     "output_type": "stream",
     "text": [

      "\n",
      "=> The column(s) below matched your filter(s) and were ran through a test-encoding successfully.\n",

      "['crim', 'zn', 'indus', 'nox', 'rm', 'age', 'dis', 'ptratio', 'lstat']\n",

    "    , dtypes = ['float64']\n",
    ")"
   ]

      "['chas', 'rad', 'tax']\n",

    "    , dtypes = ['int64']\n",

  {
   "cell_type": "code",
   "execution_count": 16,
   "id": "fifteen-programming",
   "metadata": {},
   "outputs": [],
   "source": [
    "splitset = featureset.make_splitset(\n",
    "    label_id = label.id\n",
    "    , size_test = 0.18\n",
    "    , size_validation = 0.12\n",
    ")"
   ]
  },
  {
   "cell_type": "code",
   "execution_count": 21,
   "id": "governing-enhancement",
   "metadata": {},
   "outputs": [],
   "source": [
    "def fn_build(features_shape, labels_shape, **hp):\n",
    "    # Just giving hyperparameter a shorter reference.\n",
    "    nc = hp['neuron_count']\n",
    "\n",
    "    model = nn.Sequential(\n",
    "        nn.Linear(features_shape[0], nc),\n",
    "        nn.BatchNorm1d(nc,nc),\n",
    "        nn.ReLU(),\n",
    "        nn.Dropout(p=0.4),\n",
    "\n",
    "        nn.Linear(nc, nc),\n",
    "        nn.BatchNorm1d(nc,nc),\n",
    "        nn.ReLU(),\n",
    "        nn.Dropout(p=0.4),\n",
    "\n",
    "        nn.Linear(nc, labels_shape[0])\n",
    "    )\n",
    "    return model"
   ]
  },
  {
   "cell_type": "code",
   "execution_count": 22,
   "id": "mounted-jewelry",
   "metadata": {},
   "outputs": [],
   "source": [
    "def fn_train(model, loser, optimizer, samples_train, samples_evaluate, **hp):\n",
    "    from torchmetrics.functional import explained_variance as expVar\n",
    "    ## --- Prepare mini batches for analysis ---\n",
    "    batched_features, batched_labels = aiqc.torch_batcher(\n",
    "        samples_train['features'], samples_train['labels'],\n",
    "        batch_size=5, enforce_sameSize=False, allow_1Sample=False\n",
    "    )\n",
    "\n",
    "    # Modeled after `keras.model.History.history` object.\n",
    "    history = {\n",
    "        'loss':list(), 'expVar': list(), \n",
    "        'val_loss':list(), 'val_expVar':list()\n",
    "    }\n",
    "\n",
    "    ## --- Training loop ---\n",
    "    epochs = 75\n",
    "    for epoch in range(epochs):\n",
    "        # --- Batch training ---\n",
    "        for i, batch in enumerate(batched_features):      \n",
    "            # Make raw (unlabeled) predictions.\n",
    "            batch_probability = model(batched_features[i])\n",
    "            batch_flat_labels = batched_labels[i].flatten()\n",
    "            #batch_loss = loser(batch_probability, batch_flat_labels)\n",
    "            batch_loss = loser(batch_probability.flatten(), batch_flat_labels)\n",
    "            # Backpropagation.\n",
    "            optimizer.zero_grad()\n",
    "            batch_loss.backward()\n",
    "            optimizer.step()\n",
    "\n",
    "        ## --- Epoch metrics ---\n",
    "        # Overall performance on training data.\n",
    "        train_probability = model(samples_train['features'])\n",
    "        train_flat_labels = samples_train['labels'].flatten()\n",
    "        train_loss = loser(train_probability.flatten(), train_flat_labels)\n",
    "        train_expVar = expVar(train_probability, samples_train['labels'])\n",
    "        history['loss'].append(float(train_loss))\n",
    "        history['expVar'].append(float(train_expVar))\n",
    "\n",
    "        # Performance on evaluation data.\n",
    "        eval_probability = model(samples_evaluate['features'])\n",
    "        eval_flat_labels = samples_evaluate['labels'].flatten()\n",
    "        eval_loss = loser(eval_probability.flatten(), eval_flat_labels)\n",
    "\n",
    "        eval_expVar = expVar(eval_probability, samples_evaluate['labels'])    \n",
    "        history['val_loss'].append(float(eval_loss))\n",
    "        history['val_expVar'].append(float(eval_expVar))\n",
    "    return model, history"
   ]
  },
  {
   "cell_type": "markdown",
   "id": "heard-equipment",
   "metadata": {},
   "source": [
    "Optional, will be automatically selected based on `analysis_type` if left as `None`."
   ]
  },
  {
   "cell_type": "code",
   "execution_count": 23,
   "id": "sought-retail",
   "metadata": {},
   "outputs": [],
   "source": [
    "def fn_lose(**hp):\n",
    "    if (hp['loss_type'] == 'mae'):\n",
    "        loser = nn.L1Loss()#mean absolute error.\n",
    "    elif (hp['loss_type'] == 'mse'):\n",
    "        loser = nn.MSELoss()\n",
    "    return loser"
   ]
  },
  {
   "cell_type": "code",
   "execution_count": 24,
   "id": "affecting-projector",
   "metadata": {},
   "outputs": [],
   "source": [
    "algorithm = aiqc.Algorithm.make(\n",
    "    library = \"pytorch\"\n",
    "    , analysis_type = \"regression\"\n",
    "    , fn_build = fn_build\n",
    "    , fn_train = fn_train\n",
    "    , fn_lose = fn_lose\n",
    ")"
   ]
  },
  {
   "cell_type": "code",
   "execution_count": 25,
   "id": "finite-equipment",
   "metadata": {},
   "outputs": [],
   "source": [
    "hyperparameters = {\n",
    "    \"neuron_count\": [22,24]\n",
    "    , \"loss_type\": [\"mae\",\"mse\"]\n",
    "}"
   ]
  },
  {
   "cell_type": "code",
   "execution_count": 26,
   "id": "maritime-infrared",
   "metadata": {},
   "outputs": [],
   "source": [
    "hyperparamset = algorithm.make_hyperparamset(\n",
    "    hyperparameters = hyperparameters\n",
    ")"
   ]
  },
  {
   "cell_type": "code",
   "execution_count": 27,
   "id": "valued-relevance",
   "metadata": {},
   "outputs": [],
   "source": [
    "queue = algorithm.make_queue(\n",
    "    splitset_id = splitset.id\n",
    "    , hyperparamset_id = hyperparamset.id\n",
    "    , labelcoder_id = labelcoder.id\n",
    "    , encoderset_id  = encoderset.id\n",
    "    , repeat_count = 1\n",
    ")"
   ]
  },
  {
   "cell_type": "code",
   "execution_count": 28,
   "id": "distinguished-court",
   "metadata": {},
   "outputs": [
    {
     "name": "stderr",
     "output_type": "stream",
     "text": [
      "ðŸ”® Training Models ðŸ”®: 100%|â–ˆâ–ˆâ–ˆâ–ˆâ–ˆâ–ˆâ–ˆâ–ˆâ–ˆâ–ˆâ–ˆâ–ˆâ–ˆâ–ˆâ–ˆâ–ˆâ–ˆâ–ˆâ–ˆâ–ˆâ–ˆâ–ˆâ–ˆâ–ˆâ–ˆâ–ˆâ–ˆâ–ˆâ–ˆâ–ˆâ–ˆâ–ˆâ–ˆâ–ˆâ–ˆâ–ˆâ–ˆâ–ˆâ–ˆâ–ˆâ–ˆâ–ˆ| 4/4 [00:45<00:00, 11.29s/it]\n"
     ]
    }
   ],
   "source": [
    "queue.run_jobs()"
   ]
  },
  {
   "cell_type": "markdown",
